description.narrative: (i) Local currency funding: IFC will provide long term funding in local currency, that is difficult to obtain from the market, to enable the Company to continue supporting and further grow its client base. The nature of the loan being with long tenor and in local currency would assist the Company to diversify its funding sources, better manage its asset and liability position, and assist the Company in avoiding taking FX risks. (ii) Access to finance: The proposed Project would support FINCA Jordan expand its outreach and serve a larger number of low-income people in rural areas of Jordan. The social and economic impact would be significantly high especially that women borrowers represent 97% of FINCA''s clients. (iii) Job creation: MSMEs are key contributors to job creation in the Country. Developing a vibrant MSME sector, with reliable access to finance, can play a significant role in private sector led economic growth, generating employment and providing opportunities to the poor and under-served groups. (v) Demonstration effect: Through this project, IFC is expected to act as a catalyst by encouraging other investors, especially local banks, to fund the microfinance sector and bridge the financing gap facing this sector.

The project involves a local currency senior loan to Specialized Micro Loans Company (FINCA Jordan or the Company). Proceeds of the loan will be used to finance the Companys existing operations and expansion of its lending activities to micro and small entrepreneurs in Jordan, especially women who represent 97% of all clients.
